properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 5 at 2:26PM PST until January 7 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a

* Flood Watch for a portion of Southwest Washington, including
the following areas, South Washington Coast and Willapa Hills.

* From Monday afternoon through late Monday night

* Heavy rain tonight and Monday will cause rapid rises on many
creeks and rivers. Rain totals of 2 to 5 inches are possible in
the Willapa Hills, and the rivers draining in and out of the
Willapa Hills could reach flood stage Monday afternoon or night.

* The river with the greatest concern of flooding is the Grays
River in Wahkiakum County since it responds quickly to excessive
rainfall.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

Landslides and debris flows are possible during this flood event.
People, structures and roads located below steep slopes, in
canyons and near the mouths of canyons may be at serious risk from
rapidly moving landslides.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT
